de.embl.rieslab.emu.ui.internalproperties

Class InternalProperty<T,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.embl.rieslab.emu.ui.internalproperties.InternalProperty<T,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Should be an Atomic type to keep the synchronization between threads.
    V - Wrapper for a primitive type the Atomic type can be easily converted to.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BoolInternalProperty, DoubleInternalProperty, IntegerInternalProperty

    public abstract class InternalProperty<T,V>
extends java.lang.Object
    An InternalProperty is aimed at passing information between ConfigurablePanels using an atomic variable of type T. In the ConfigurablePanel, the value can then be retrieved as a wrapper for one of the corresponding primitive type. An InternalProperty is instantiated with a name. InternalProperties with the same name will be shared between the different ConfigurablePanels that created them, as long as they are of the same InternalPropertyType.

    Upon modification of its value, through a call to setInternalPropertyValue(Object, ConfigurablePanel), the value of the atomic variable is updated and a call to all other listeners (ConfigurablePanel) except the source of the call notifies them of the change.

    Author:
    Joran Deschamps

      • setInternalPropertyValue

        public void setInternalPropertyValue(V val,
                                     ConfigurablePanel source)
        Sets the value of the InternalProperty to val and notifies all listeners but the source.
        Parameters:
        val - New value
        source - ConfigurablePanel at the origin of the update

      • registerListener

        public void registerListener(ConfigurablePanel listener)
        Registers listener. If listener has an InternalProperty with same name and type, then the InternalProperty is replaced by this one in the ConfigurablePanel. If no such InternalProperty exists, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        listener - ConfigurablePanel with an InternalProperty with same name and type

        public abstract InternalProperty.InternalPropertyType getType()
        Returns the type of InternalProperty.
        Returns:
        InternalProperty type.
